title: Places & Location Particles
context: 에 marks location or destination; 에서 marks where an action happens.
Knowing a few building words helps with errands and commuting.
Attach place + 에/에서 before the verb—no prepositions needed.

sentences.english: I'm going to the office now.
On weekends I exercise at the park.
The bank is next to the market.
There are many books at the library.

explanation: 에 answers 'to/at/in' for states or destinations: 집에 있어요 (at home), 학교에 가요 (go to school).
에서 answers 'at/in' for actions: 집에서 공부해요 (study at home), 회사에서 일해요 (work at the office).
With movement verbs 가다/오다, use 에: 집에 가요. With action verbs like 일하다/공부하다, use 에서.
Position words pair with 에: 학교 옆에 (next to), 시장 안에 (inside), 공원 근처에 (near the park).
Order: [Place + particle] + [time word] + verb is flexible. Common flow: 오늘 학교에서 수업해요 (Today at school I have class).
